info.title: WPPConnect API Rest
info.description: Welcome to the wppconnect-server API documentation. This API provides a set of endpoints to interact with the wppconnect-server application, allowing you to build integrations and automate interactions with WhatsApp.

tags.name: Contact
tags.description: Handles operations related to contacts, such as managing contact lists, adding or removing contacts, and retrieving contact information.

tags.name: Catalog & Bussiness
tags.description: Handles operations related to catalogs and business-related functionalities, such as managing product catalogs and business information.

tags.name: Messages
tags.description: Handles message-related operations, including sending, receiving, and managing messages.

tags.name: Profile
tags.description: Manages user profile-related operations, such as retrieving and updating profile information

tags.name: Status Stories
tags.description: Handles operations related to status stories, such as viewing, updating, and managing status stories

tags.name: Labels
tags.description: Manages labels or tags associated with chats or messages for organization and categorization purposes.

tags.name: Group
tags.description: Manages operations related to WhatsApp groups, such as creating, modifying, and managing group settings.

tags.name: Misc
tags.description: Handles miscellaneous operations that do not fit into other specific categories.

post.description: This route logout and delete session data

post.description: Change limits of whatsapp web. Types value: maxMediaSize, maxFileSize, maxShare, statusVideoMaxDuration, unlimitedPin;
You can point your Chatwoot to this route so that it can perform functions.

get.description: This endpoint can be used to check the health status of the API. It returns a response with a status code indicating the API
This endpoint is used to force the API into an unhealthy state. It can be useful for testing error handling or simulating service disruptions.
This endpoint can be used to check the status of API metrics. It returns a response with the collected metrics.
